medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports two months of increasing epigastric abdominal pain that has acutely worsened over the last two weeks. Pain is described as burning/pressure pain that is constant and worsens with eating and drinking, leading to minimal oral intake. Accompanying symptoms include nausea and episodes of vomiting, with a report of small amounts of bright red blood in emesis. The patient has experienced a 65 lbs weight loss over the past two months attributed to poor oral intake due to abdominal pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Poorly-controlled diabetes, chronic abdominal pain, compensated cirrhosis, anxiety, PTSD, psoriasis, NASH, splenomegaly, candidal balanitis.
